approveMaximumOnPerpetual(address).details: Cannot be run in the constructor due to technical restrictions in Solidity.

approveMaximumOnSolo(uint256).details: Cannot be run in the constructor due to technical restrictions in Solidity.

params.signature: (Optional) Signature for the transfer, will be checked if sender does not                   have permission to operate the account.

params.transfer: The parameters for the signature that will be invalidated.

approveMaximumOnPerpetual(address).notice: Sets the maximum allowance on the Perpetual contract. Must be called at least once on a given Perpetual before deposits can be made.

approveMaximumOnSolo(uint256).notice: Sets the maximum allowance on the Solo contract for a given market. Must be called at least once on a given market before deposits can be made.

bridgeTransfer((address,address,uint256,.notice: Executes a transfer from Solo to Perpetual or vice vera.

invalidateSignature((address,address,uin.notice: Invalidate a signature, given the exact transfer parameters.

userdoc.notice: Facilitates transfers between the PerpetualV1 and Solo smart contracts.
